title: ERROR ethers_solc::resolver: failed to resolve versions
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (98fa895 2022-09-27T22:27:26.550668Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge build

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

Same with [Failed to resolve versions ethers_solc #2232](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/discussions/2232).

```
macbook-pro:prereqs atatekeli$ forge build
[⠃] Compiling...2024-01-07T16:36:08.170101Z ERROR ethers_solc::resolver: failed to resolve versions
[⠊] Compiling...
Error:
Discovered incompatible solidity versions in following
: script/Counter.s.sol (^0.8.20) imports:
    lib/forge-std/src/Script.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/console.sol (>=0.4.22 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/console2.sol (>=0.4.22 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/safeconsole.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdChains.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdCheats.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdJson.sol (>=0.6.0 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdMath.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)

    lib/forge-std/src/StdStyle.sol (>=0.4.22 <0.9.0)

    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Base.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdStorage.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/console2.sol (>=0.4.22 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/interfaces/IMulticall3.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/mocks/MockERC20.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/mocks/MockERC721.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdStorage.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
Discovered incompatible solidity versions in following
: src/Counter.sol (^0.8.20) imports:
Discovered incompatible solidity versions in following
: src/MyToken.sol (^0.8.20) imports:
    lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol (^0.8.20)
    lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol (^0.8.20)
    lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/IERC20Metadata.sol (^0.8.20)
    lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Context.sol (^0.8.20)
    lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/interfaces/draft-IERC6093.sol (^0.8.20)
    lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol (^0.8.20)
Discovered incompatible solidity versions in following
: test/Counter.t.sol (^0.8.20) imports:
    lib/forge-std/src/Test.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    src/Counter.sol (^0.8.20)
    lib/forge-std/src/console.sol (>=0.4.22 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/console2.sol (>=0.4.22 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/safeconsole.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdAssertions.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdChains.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdCheats.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdError.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdInvariant.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdJson.sol (>=0.6.0 <0.9.0)

    lib/forge-std/lib/ds-test/src/test.sol (>=0.5.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdMath.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/StdStorage.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/console2.sol (>=0.4.22 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/interfaces/IMulticall3.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/mocks/MockERC20.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/mocks/MockERC721.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)

    lib/forge-std/src/StdStorage.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
    lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol (>=0.6.2 <0.9.0)
```
Any chance you could share a minimum reproducible example, or just a GitHub repository?
The problem is that when I say `foundryup`, it says command not found. And for repo, here's the [repo](https://github.com/Killpit/web3-security-course/tree/main/prereqs) of mine

Oh wow this is a really old version yeah. Please update using foundryup. If the command is not found, chances are you have either not installed it, or the permissions on foundryup are incorrect. Just reinstall foundryup with the instructions in the README or on the website.
foundryup is not working, but I have forge, chisel, anvil and cast in cargo. I consider removing all the packages, and then installing foundry either using brew or from the docs.
Any way works fine, but please update to the latest version - whether through foundryup, building from source or homebrew.
Foundryup says command not found, I consider using brew

> source

Should I delete packages beforehand

Here are more details, I think that can help more diagnosing the issue

```
macbook-pro:~ atatekeli$ cargo install --list
anvil v0.2.0 (https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry#a5171a4a):
    anvil
avm v0.26.0 (https://github.com/coral-xyz/anchor#06c42327):
    anchor
    avm
chisel v0.2.0 (https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry#a5171a4a):
    chisel
foundry-cli v0.2.0 (/Users/atatekeli/foundry/cli):
    cast
    forge
rustlings v5.2.1 (/Users/atatekeli/rustlings):
    rustlings
seahorse-lang v0.2.7:
    seahorse
trdelnik-cli v0.4.0:
    trdelnik
```

> Oh wow this is a really old version yeah. Please update using foundryup. If the command is not found, chances are you have either not installed it, or the permissions on foundryup are incorrect. Just reinstall foundryup with the instructions in the README or on the website.

I decided to use the cargo command

With cargo command according to documentation, but no foundryup @onbjerg @tolbrino @adhusson @huitseeker 

```
forge 0.2.0 (71d8ea5 2024-01-09T14:39:42.577446000Z)
macbook-pro:~ atatekeli$ cast --version
cast 0.2.0 (71d8ea5 2024-01-09T14:42:29.595610000Z)
macbook-pro:~ atatekeli$ chisel --version
chisel 0.2.0 (71d8ea5 2024-01-09T14:45:10.956457000Z)
macbook-pro:~ atatekeli$ anvil --version
anvil 0.2.0 (71d8ea5 2024-01-09T14:47:33.371278000Z)

```

@onbjerg @tolbrino @adhusson @huitseeker 

```
macbook-pro:~ atatekeli$ curl -L https://foundry.paradigm.xyz | bash
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
  0     0    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--     0
100  1942  100  1942    0     0   4032      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--  4032
Installing foundryup...
######################################################################## 100.0%

Detected your preferred shell is bash and added foundryup to PATH. Run 'source /Users/atatekeli/.bashrc' or start a new terminal session to use foundryup.
Then, simply run 'foundryup' to install Foundry.
macbook-pro:~ atatekeli$ foundryup
-bash: foundryup: command not found

```

\>With cargo command according to documentation, but no foundryup

Foundryup is not installed via cargo. Please follow the instructions on https://getfoundry.sh

> >With cargo command according to documentation, but no foundryup
> 
> Foundryup is not installed via cargo. Please follow the instructions on https://getfoundry.sh

I follow the instructions and get the same command not found

![Ekran Resmi 2024-01-10 10 38 39](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/assets/57031187/b9f21a3a-a899-4270-b106-70c32f4ed4cc)
![Ekran Resmi 2024-01-10 10 38 19](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/assets/57031187/009f44c2-0aa0-476a-a4fe-95cb116be741)

Are there additional steps I should do to address the situation

Currently I've uninstalled cargo packages for foundry, deleted the directory through terminal and removed all export paths through terminal. I'll retry installing foundry again with curl command @onbjerg

> >With cargo command according to documentation, but no foundryup
> 
> Foundryup is not installed via cargo. Please follow the instructions on https://getfoundry.sh

After reinstalling Foundry on macOS using foundryup, I can't run foundryup in the VS Code terminal. The error message says forge not found. I've reloaded VS Code and checked my PATH, but it's still not working. I'm using VS Code v1.55.0 and Foundry v0.2.0." with all the dependencies as the latest version, I just used the documentation, curl command, source and foundryup

![Ekran Resmi 2024-01-13 13 49 27](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/assets/57031187/3e66761c-019f-4ccf-9e33-497e8f739ff9)

![Ekran Resmi 2024-01-13 13 55 36](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/assets/57031187/1db620cc-67ab-4f39-a810-28fdb75b8d8d)

```
macbook-pro:web3-security-course atatekeli$ cd prereqs
macbook-pro:prereqs atatekeli$ forge init prereqs
bash: forge: command not found
macbook-pro:prereqs atatekeli$ forge init
bash: forge: command not found
macbook-pro:prereqs atatekeli$ forge init
bash: forge: command not found
```
Are you sure that your PATH is correct for bash? Note, `.zshrc` file is only for zsh.

> Are you sure that your PATH is correct for bash? Note, `.zshrc` file is only for zsh.


You might want to have a look, I use `bash` pretty much every time

```
macbook-pro:~ atatekeli$ echo $PATH
/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.10/bin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.11/bin:/Users/atatekeli/.local/share/solana/install/active_release/bin:/opt/homebrew/bin:/opt/homebrew/sbin:/Users/atatekeli/.cargo/bin:/Users/atatekeli/.yarn/bin:/Users/atatekeli/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/.bin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.9/bin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.9/bin:/Users/atatekeli/bin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.9/bin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.9/bin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/bin:/opt/anaconda3/bin:/Users/atatekeli/Downloads/anaconda3/bin:/Users/atatekeli/opt/anaconda3/condabin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/bin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/bin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/bin:/usr/local/bin:/System/Cryptexes/App/usr/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin:/var/run/com.apple.security.cryptexd/codex.system/bootstrap/usr/local/bin:/var/run/com.apple.security.cryptexd/codex.system/bootstrap/usr/bin:/var/run/com.apple.security.cryptexd/codex.system/bootstrap/usr/appleinternal/bin:/Library/Apple/usr/bin:/usr/local/share/dotnet:~/.dotnet/tools:/usr/local/go/bin:/Users/atatekeli/go/bin:/Users/atatekeli/go/bin:/Users/atatekeli/go/bin:/Users/atatekeli/go/bin
macbook-pro:~ atatekeli$ cat source /Users/atatekeli/.bashrc
cat: source: No such file or directory

export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm"
[ -s "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh" ] && \. "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh"  # This loads nvm
[ -s "$NVM_DIR/bash_completion" ] && \. "$NVM_DIR/bash_completion"  # This loads nvm bash_completion

export PATH="$PATH: /Users/atatekeli/flutter/flutter/bin"

export PATH="$PATH:/Users/atatekeli/.foundry/bin"
macbook-pro:~ atatekeli$ /Users/atatekeli/.foundry/bin
-bash: /Users/atatekeli/.foundry/bin: is a directory

```
